Want to speak, sponsor or volunteer?

UX Brighton is an open community group and we welcome all support.

If you'd like to get involved - by sponsoring, volunteering or speaking at one of our events - give us a shout on Twitter at @uxbri

The Team

Danny HopeFounder

Danny is an user experience consultant and the founder of UX Brighton. He curates the annual UX Brighton conference. Danny is also the co-found of JS Bin, a tool for experimenting with web languages.

Emmeline Caines-GoobyConference Event Manager

Emm has been the conference organiser since 2011, pulling together the myriad strands (and nagging Danny) to ensure the conference runs like clockwork. Emm loves lists and spreadsheets. And notebooks (the paper kind).

Luke HayOrganiser

Luke is the UX Director at No Pork Pies where his main responsibility is to give clients insight into what users are doing on their websites. His primary focus is on user behaviour and how people interact with sites and apps.

Alex GoluszkoOrganiser

Alex is a designer and user experience practitioner with a keen interest in novel UIs and a passion for diversity in technology and design. She's been curating UX Brighton events since 2012, covering mobile user testing, healthcare UX and the Internet of Things.

Patrick SansomOrganiser

Patrick founded UX Camp Brighton in 2011 and has run the event for the last three years. Currently working as a Digital Consultant at Brilliant Noise, focusing on UX strategy and delivery.

Tom PriorOrganiser and Volunteer

Tom is the Creative Lead at Makemedia, and has been designing professionally since graduating in 2005. Tom collaborates closely with UX and development teams to develop the creative direction of projects from discovery workshops through to front-end fruition.

Tim MinorOrganiser and Volunteer

Tim has been discussing, scoping, wireframing, designing and occasionally developing the front-ends of websites and user experiences since 1999 focusing on user experience and accessibility. Tim is a Conversion Consultant at Propellernet.

Harry BrignullOrganiser

Harry is an independent user experience consultant who blogs at 90percentofeverything.com and curates Darkpatterns.org â€” a site dedicated to understanding deceptive user interfaces, with the aim of stamping them out and improving the web for everyone.

Paul FergusonVolunteer

Paul asked to be described as an inquisitive frontend developer with a bike addiction. Also a great and helpful guy!

The UX Brighton website was developed by Alex and Danny but anyone can contribute to it. Find us on GitHub.
